name: Cullen International
goal:
Cullen International tracks, reports and benchmarks developments in telecommunications, media, post and digital economy regulation across Europe, in Latin America, the Middle East and North Africa.

It provides monitoring services, neutral and independent analysis, benchmarking of national regulatory situations and practices, research tailored to individual needs and training programmes.
Clients include over two hundred key industry players and public organisations spanning the whole communications industry.

Cullen International does not engage in lobbying activities, nor does it represent the views of any of its clients.
interests: Audiovisual and Media, Competition, Consumer Affairs, Culture, General and Institutional Affairs, Home Affairs, Information Society, Internal Market, Justice and Fundamental Rights
euInitiatives:
-Review of the EU regulatory framework for electronic communications
-Review of the ePrivacy Directive
- Audiovisual Media Services (AVSM) Directive
-Wholesale Roaming Regulation
-Decision on the use of the 470-790 MHz band
-Proposed Directive on Copyright in the Digital Single Market
-Proposed Content Portability Regulation
-Proposed Geo-blocking Regulation
-Proposal for a regulation on rights clearance for cross-border broadcastersâ€™ online services and retransmission of programmes
